solution_line_template: Samson will need {total_distance} km/{distance_per_unit_gas} km = <<{total_distance}/{distance_per_unit_gas}={number_of_gas_units}>>{number_of_gas_units} ten liters of gasoline for a one-way trip to a town.
Therefore, he will need a total of {number_of_gas_units} x {liters_per_unit} liters = <<{number_of_gas_units}*{liters_per_unit}={total_gasoline_needed}>>{total_gasoline_needed} liters of gasoline.
